name: materialization
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an occasion when someone or something appears, often suddenly: The book charts the earth's evolution up until the materialization of Homo sapiens. A little strange is the materialization throughout the movie of an odd couple who observe the action.
the fact of an idea or hope becoming real: She could not envisage the materialization of the plan. See
materialize
More examplesFewer examplesResearchers hope to prove that vaccinations can help the body recognize and destroy cancer cells prior to the materialization of tumors. This historic decision is a materialization of a campaign promise. The work is most often a materialization of my personal cultural experiences.The photograph was like a materialization of his desire.
